original: Åsander, Per Albert Sigvard, civil-inigenjör, Göteborg, f. 21/11/04 i Sundsvall. G. 41 m. Gertrud Huth. — Utex. fr. Örebro tekn. gymn. 24, avg:ex. v. KTH (E) 29, skepparex. 2:a kl. 34. Anst. v. Skönviks Kraftv. i Sundsvall 24-26, Skönviks Gellulosafabr. i Ort-viken, Sundsvall, 26, ASEA i Västerås 29, Graham Brothers dottibol., A-B Elevator i Ulriksdal 30, chef f. Graham Brothers A-B el. avd. där 36, konsult, o. besiktn :ing. f. hissar, lyft-inrättn. o. el. anläggn. v. Mell. o. Norra Sv:es Angpanneförendngs elekt-rotekn. avd. i Gbg 42. Led. av Sv. tekn :fören. fr. 29.
translated:
Translated:

Åsander, Per Albert Sigvard, civil engineer, Gothenburg, born 21/11/04 in Sundsvall. Married in 1941 to Gertrud Huth. Graduated from Örebro Technical Gymnasium in 1924, completed an examination at KTH (E) in 1929, and obtained a second-class ship captain certificate in 1934. Employed at Skönviks Power Plant in Sundsvall from 1924 to 1926, Skönviks Cellulose Factory in Ort-viken, Sundsvall, in 1926, ASEA in Västerås in 1929, Graham Brothers daughter company, A-B Elevator in Ulriksdal in 1930, became the head of Graham Brothers A-B electrical department in 1936, and worked as a consultant and inspector for elevators, lifting devices, and electrical installations at the Central and Northern Sweden Steam Boiler Association's electrical department in Gothenburg from 1942. A member of the Swedish Technical Association since 1929.
